Package com.here.platform.location.core.mapmatching.javadsl

Class Interpolators

java.lang.Object
com.here.platform.location.core.mapmatching.javadsl.Interpolators
public class Interpolators extends Object

This is an experimental API. It may be removed or changed from one version to the next.

Contains factory methods for Interpolators.

      public Interpolators()

  • Method Details

    • filteredToUnknown

      public static <O, V, T> Interpolator<O,V,T> filteredToUnknown()
      Creates an Interpolator that inserts an Unknown for each observation that was marked to be Omitted. It updates only the indices of transitions contained in matchedPath but does not add or remove transitions.

    • projecting

      public static <O extends GeoCoordinateHolder, V, T> Interpolator<O,V,T> projecting(PropertyMap<V,LineStringHolder<GeoCoordinate>> geometry)
      Creates an Interpolator that tries to insert an OnRoad result for each Omitted observation by projecting the observation onto the matchedPath.

      If a transition connects two OnRoad results for Retained observations, then any Omitted observation that occurred between these observations is covered by this transition and is interpolated to an OnRoad.

      The Interpolator inserts an Unknown for each Omitted observation that is not covered by such a transition between OnRoads.

      It also ensures that the interpolated OnRoad results are in order along the matchedPath.

      Parameters:
      geometry - Used to translate a path made of Vs to a line string (sequence of geocoordinates).

      Use this overload of the method when the geographical coordinate type implements GeoCoordinateHolder.

    • projecting

      public static <O, V, T> Interpolator<O,V,T> projecting(PropertyMap<V,LineStringHolder<GeoCoordinate>> geometry, GeoCoordinateAdapter<O> adapter)
      Creates an Interpolator that tries to insert an OnRoad result for each Omitted observation by projecting the observation onto the matchedPath.

      If a transition connects two OnRoad results for Retained observations, then any Omitted observation that occurred between these observations is covered by this transition and is interpolated to an OnRoad.

      The Interpolator inserts an Unknown for each Omitted observation that is not covered by such a transition between OnRoads.

      It also ensures that the interpolated OnRoad results are in order along the matchedPath.

      Parameters:
      geometry - Used to translate a path made of Vs to a line string (sequence of geocoordinates).
      adapter - Adapter to extract latitude and longitude from O

      Use this overload of the method when the geographical coordinate type does not implement GeoCoordinateHolder.
